intro: Barleria volkensii, commonly known as the red-hot poker or fire plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in spikes. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Barleria volkensii is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
